definition: to break/to smash
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to go to the bottom of things (idiom)
pinyin: da3 po4 sha1 guo1 wen4 dao4 di3

sentences.english: Will they beat the 83 century record for the championships?Yes or no?
sentences.chinese: 他们这次比赛能打破原来83次单球破百的记录吗？

sentences.english: He egged her on  to throw a stone through the window.
sentences.chinese: 他怂恿她扔一块石头打破窗户。

sentences.english: This would forever settle many minds that were now in uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 这就会使许多人心中的闷葫芦打破了。

sentences.english: The minute she is hooked youwant to break rapport.
sentences.chinese: 她迷上你的那一刻就会想打破融洽。

sentences.english: This bloke was breaking the unwritten rules for men.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙打破了男人们应该遵守的不成文规则。

sentences.english: Conclusion We can break the host's specificity of Eperythrozoon.
sentences.chinese: 结论附红细胞体的宿主特异性可被打破。

sentences.english: I encourage patients to find a way to break the cycle.
sentences.chinese: 我鼓励患者发现一种打破怪圈的方法。

sentences.english: At last the goatherd threw a stone, and breaking its horn.
sentences.chinese: 最后这个牧羊人扔了块石头打破了羊的角。

sentences.english: They are not afraid to break with convention.
This record, however, was broken in the non-influential game at Reggio Calabria.
sentences.chinese: 不过这个纪录还是在对雷吉那的比赛中被打破了。

sentences.english: Ray just broke Reggie's NBA 3-point record this season.
sentences.chinese: 雷阿伦在该赛季刚刚打破了雷吉米勒的三分球记录。

sentences.english: The solution is to break up this insulating layer of hot water by agitation.
sentences.chinese: 方案是用搅拌的方法打破热水构成的隔热层。

sentences.english: Cardboard, Thick round Reel centers, broke down.
sentences.chinese: 纸板，厚圆卷筒中心，打破了。

sentences.english: I'll try to find out who broken the window.
sentences.chinese: 我会想法子查出谁打破了那扇窗户。

sentences.english: Break a mirror who works as a knife.
sentences.chinese: 打破倒车镜，把碎玻璃当刀用。

sentences.english: The record he holds has not been broken so far.
sentences.chinese: 他保持的记录至今还没有人打破。

definition: variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
impasse/deadlock
(magical) spell/curse
to renovate/to refurbish/to refresh (computer window)/to write a new page (in history)/to break (a record)
to surpass/to exceed/to transcend
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to continue/to go on/to last
breakthrough/to overcome an obstacle quickly
to break through/to make a breakthrough/to surmount or break the back of (a task etc)/(of ball sports) to break through a defense
intrinsic to sth/inherent/native
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to topple (i.e. knock over)/to capsize/fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion)/to undermine/to subvert
to establish/to set (a new record)
end/conclusion/to come to an end/to terminate (sth)
once more/once again/one more time
